attributes.action: Broadcasters that advertise as news channels must be regulated as news channels.
attributes.additional_details: Rogue broadcasters are using their status as entertainment channels to bypass existing impartiality legislation that their competitors are held to, while masquerading as news broadcasters.
attributes.background: Broadcasters that attempt to avoid impartiality laws pertaining to news broadcasters by registering as entertainment channels, should be forced under law to change their name or respect existing legislation.

rejection.details: Requirements relating to impartially are set out in the Broadcasting Code and are the responsibility of Ofcom. Further information is available here: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/tv-radio-and-on-demand/broadcast-codes/broadcast-code/section-five-due-impartiality-accuracy
